I do not have personal experience, but here is some information on sustainable features that are popular in dubai's buildings:

dubai is making a concerted effort to be a leader in sustainable architecture, and many of the city's buildings are now incorporating innovative and eco-friendly design features. some of the most popular sustainable features in dubai's buildings are:

1. solar panels - one of the most effective ways to make buildings more sustainable is by integrating solar panels into their design. many buildings in dubai now feature solar panels that harness the energy of the sun to power the building's systems.

2. green roofs - another popular sustainable feature in dubai's buildings is green roofs, which are covered with plants and foliage. these roofs help to keep buildings cool in the hot desert climate, and they also provide a habitat for wildlife and help to absorb rainwater.

3. recycled building materials - dubai is home to several buildings that have been constructed using recycled materials, such as reclaimed wood or recycled plastic. this helps to reduce waste and carbon emissions by repurposing materials that would otherwise end up in landfills.

4. energy-efficient lighting - led lighting is becoming increasingly popular in dubai's buildings, as it is more energy-efficient than traditional lighting sources. additionally, many buildings are now installing motion sensors and other smart systems to automatically turn off lights when they are not needed.

5. water-saving features - in a desert city like dubai, water conservation is crucial. many new buildings are now incorporating features such as low-flow toilets and showerheads, as well as innovative water recycling systems that capture and treat wastewater for reuse.

overall, dubai's architects are finding innovative ways to make buildings more sustainable, with a focus on energy efficiency, water conservation, and the use of recycled materials.
